[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: set_coin()] [Integer underflow] Does set_coin() allow setting coin balance to 0 when actual withdrawals haven't occurred, enabling attackers to drain accounts by manipulating the coin field directly without proper validation? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResource] [Integer overflow] When the coin field (u64) reaches u64::MAX (18,446,744,073,709,551,615), can deposit operations cause silent wraparound to 0, resulting in massive fund loss for holders of large balances? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: coin()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker exploit the u64 return type of coin() to cause integer overflow in arithmetic operations performed by consuming code, leading to incorrect balance calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResourceUntyped] [Data integrity] Does CoinStoreResourceUntyped lack proper validation allowing coin values beyond economic security limits (e.g., > total supply), enabling inflationary attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: frozen()] [Access control bypass] Can the frozen flag be read but not enforced during withdrawals in external code, allowing attackers to bypass freeze restrictions and withdraw from frozen accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResource] [State manipulation] Is there a race condition where frozen status can be checked and then changed before withdrawal completes, enabling TOCTOU (time-of-check-time-of-use) attacks to drain frozen accounts? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Field: frozen] [Privilege escalation] Can a malicious Move module directly deserialize and modify the frozen field to false, bypassing governance freeze actions and unfreezing sanctioned addresses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: frozen()] [Logic error] Does the absence of set_frozen() method in the public API mean frozen state can only be changed via deserialization, creating inconsistent enforcement across different code paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResourceUntyped] [Type safety] Can frozen state be manipulated independently in CoinStoreResourceUntyped vs CoinStoreResource<C>, causing inconsistent freeze enforcement across typed and untyped variants? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: deposit_events_mut()] [Event corruption] Can an attacker use deposit_events_mut() to replace the EventHandle with a malicious one pointing to a different GUID, causing deposit events to be emitted under an attacker-controlled event stream? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: withdraw_events_mut()] [Audit trail manipulation] Can withdraw_events_mut() be exploited to reset event counters or change event stream destinations, enabling attackers to hide withdrawal transactions from indexers and auditing systems? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Field: deposit_events] [Event replay] If deposit_events EventHandle is cloned or duplicated across multiple CoinStore instances, can event sequence numbers collide, causing transaction indexers to drop legitimate events and hide malicious deposits? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Field: withdraw_events] [Accounting inconsistency] Can the withdraw_events EventHandle be corrupted such that emitted events have amounts that don't match actual coin field changes, breaking off-chain balance tracking and causing fund reconciliation failures? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: deposit_events()] [Information leak] Does exposing EventHandle via deposit_events() allow attackers to read event stream metadata (GUID, counter) to predict future event IDs and front-run transactions based on anticipated event emissions? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: withdraw_events()] [State inconsistency] If withdraw_events() returns a reference that becomes stale after mutations, can concurrent transactions see inconsistent event handle state causing duplicated or skipped event emissions?
